V.iii.1.B.1.b
.
Example of Separate Evaluations for Disabilities of the Shoulder and Arm
Situation
:  A Veteran was involved in an automobile accident that resulted in multiple injuries to the upper extremities.  The Veteran sustained the following injuries
a humeral fracture resulting in restriction of arm motion at shoulder level, and
a clavicular fracture resulting in malunion of the clavicle.
Result
:
assign a 20-percent evaluation for the impairment of the humerus under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5202-5201
, and
assign a separate 10-percent evaluation for malunion of the clavicle under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5203
.
Notes
:
The hyphenated evaluation DC is assigned under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5202-5201
because the humerus impairment affects range of motion (ROM).
The separate evaluation for the clavicle disability is warranted because this disability does not affect ROM.
Exception
:  Multiple evaluations cannot be assigned under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5201
for limited flexion and abduction of the shoulder.
Reference
:  For more information on evaluating shoulder conditions, see
Yonek v. Shinseki
, 722 F.3d 1355 (Fed. Cir. 2013).
